intro: Cyrtandra prasina, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and stream banks. Cyrtandra prasina has smooth, oval leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat and is considered a rare species due to habitat loss and invasive species.
